etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Frederic Bower (1855–1948), botanist. From phyllo- + -podium

definitions: The main axis of a leaf or a fern frond.
Specifically. An expanded and hardened leaf-base found in certain quillworts (family Isoetaceae), providing protection for dormant meristematic tissue.
A broad, flattened limb of the kind found in branchiopod crustaceans.
